721471f-a.title: Manhattan: Madison Avenue - 122nd Street
721471f-a.text:
Madison Avenue, east side, from 122nd to 123rd Streets, showing
brownstone fronts and a glimpse of the Hospital for Joint Diseases.
July 24, 1932.
P. L. Sperr, Photographer.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
'7170  NV2: :

721472f-c.title: Manhattan: Madison Avenue - 122nd Street
721472f-c.text:
tadison Avene, east side, south from E. 123ed (left of view 1)
to 12Oth (richt of Viev 3) Streets, showirg several blocks of brown
stone dwellings facinm on Nount horris Park. View No. 1 shows the
123rd to 122nd Street block; No. 2 an extensive view southward from
122nd Street; and No. 3, the 121st to 120th Street block. Shown
at the N.E. corner of this thorouhfare and E. 121st Street is the
Russian Orthodox Church of Christ the Saviour. Upon this site
formerly stood a one story structure listed in Bromleys Atlas of
New York of 1922 as the property of the Rnichts of Columbus.
Aumst 24, 1938.
Views 1,2 and 3.
P.L. Sperr
NO RRPRODUCTIONS.
